title: Sequential Promise Execution
description: Execute promises one after another in sequence
instructions:
Write an async function `processSequentially(numbers)` that processes an array of numbers one at a time. For each number, wait 50ms and then double it. Return an array of all doubled numbers.

IMPORTANT: Process numbers sequentially (one after another), not in parallel.

Example: processSequentially([1, 2, 3]) should return [2, 4, 6]

hints.content: Use a for loop with await to process each number sequentially. Create a promise for each number that waits 50ms.
Create an empty results array. Use a for...of loop to iterate through numbers. For each number, await a promise that uses setTimeout, then push the doubled value to results.
Use: `for (const num of numbers) { await new Promise((resolve) => { setTimeout(() => { results.push(num * 2); resolve(); }, 50); }); }`

learningObjectives: Sequential async execution with for loops
